text: South Xinjiang or Nanjiang () is the southern half of the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China. Its historical name was Altishahr (), which also includes some territories in modern-day Afghanistan, Kyrgyzstan, and Tajikistan. South Xinjiang includes Tarim Basin and the adjacent mountainous area which includes Aksai Chin. Most of the inhabitants in Southern Xinjiang are Uyghurs. == See also == * Altishahr * Dzungaria ** Junggar Basin * Southern Xinjiang railway * Tarim Basin Category:Geography of Xinjiang
title: South Xinjiang
